overview: From 2025-07-15 to 2025-07-16, elizaos/eliza had 14 new PRs (15 merged), 3 new issues, and 6 active contributors.

topIssues.title: Service Types and Test Services
topIssues.author: lalalune
topIssues.body:
We can broadly group our services into types, and it can be handy for building abstract plugins that depend on other services. For example, if I want to make a trading plugin, it'd be neat if I could just call runtime.getServicesByType('wallet') and it'd return all wallets attached to the runtime.

Standard list of types off the bat: PDF, VideoDownload, Wallet, Message, Post, Database, TokenData, etc.

These should be interfaces with functions that are standardized, so that for example any wallet has a getBalance feature.

We should have a dummy service for each of these which has in-memory test functions that other services can depend on for running tests etc.

topIssues.title: Custom Plugin Schema migration issues
topIssues.author: borisudovicic
topIssues.body: Steps to reproduce: 1. Schema Files ``` import { pgTable, text, uuid, timestamp, pgEnum } from "drizzle-orm/pg-core"; export const suggestionTypeEnum = pgEnum("suggestion_type", ["buy", "sell"]); export const suggestionStatusEnum = pgEnum("suggestion_status", ["pending", "resolved", "rejected"]); export const pluginSuggestionsTable = pgTable("plugin_suggestions", { id: uuid("id").primaryKey().defaultRandom(), type: suggestionTypeEnum("type").notNull(), ticker: text("ticker").notNull(), status: suggestionStatusEnum("status").notNull().default("pending"), createdAt: timestamp("created_at").defaultNow().notNull(), }); ``` 2. Insert the schema in plugin (check the image) 3. In my env I have POSTGRES_URL 4. Run: bun run dev 5. LOGS (in order, check images)

topPRs.title: feat: implement service types and standardized interfaces with getServicesByType() method
topPRs.author: wtfsayo
topPRs.body:
This PR implements the service types and test services system requested in issue #4914.

## Key Features

- **getServicesByType() method**: Returns all services of a specific type
- **Multiple services per type**: Support for multiple wallet services, PDF services, etc.
- **Standardized interfaces**: Created comprehensive interfaces for all major service types
- **Test services**: Comprehensive dummy services for all interfaces
- **Backward compatibility**: Existing getService() method still works

## Service Interfaces Added

- IPdfService - PDF processing, extraction, generation
- IVideoService - Video download, processing, conversion
- IBrowserService - Web browser automation and scraping
- ITranscriptionService - Audio transcription and speech processing
- IWebSearchService - Web search and content discovery
- IEmailService - Email sending, receiving, management
- IMessageService - Message sending and management
- IPostService - Social media posting and content management

## Usage Example

```typescript
// Get all wallet services attached to runtime
const walletServices = runtime.getServicesByType<IWalletService>('wallet');

// Get all PDF services
const pdfServices = runtime.getServicesByType<IPdfService>('pdf');
```

Closes #4914

topPRs.title: feat(cli): add plugin-quick-starter template for backend-only plugins
topPRs.author: 0xbbjoker
topPRs.body:
## üéØ Overview

This PR introduces a new `plugin-quick-starter` template alongside the existing `plugin-starter` template to provide developers with a streamlined option for creating backend-only plugins without frontend overhead.

## üîÑ Changes

### New Template: `plugin-quick-starter`

- Created a new lightweight plugin template focused on backend functionality
- Removed all frontend dependencies (React, Vite, Tailwind, Cypress)
- Simplified build configuration to use only tsup
- Reduced test infrastructure to unit tests only
- Minimal package.json with only essential dependencies

### CLI Enhancements

- Added plugin type selection when users run `elizaos create [plugin-name]`
- Two options presented:
  - **Quick Plugin (Backend Only)** - Uses `plugin-quick-starter` template
  - **Full Plugin (with Frontend)** - Uses existing `plugin-starter` template
- Updated `createPlugin` function to accept plugin type parameter
- Modified template mapping to support both templates

### Template Infrastructure

- Updated `copy-templates.js` to include `plugin-quick-starter` in build process
- Both templates are now copied to CLI templates directory during build
- No changes to existing `plugin-starter` template (maintains backward compatibility)

## üìä Comparison

| Feature      | plugin-quick-starter | plugin-starter       |
| ------------ | -------------------- | -------------------- |
| Frontend     | ‚ùå None              | ‚úÖ React + Vite      |
| Styling      | ‚ùå None              | ‚úÖ Tailwind CSS      |
| Build Tools  | tsup only            | tsup + Vite          |
| Testing      | Unit tests only      | Unit + E2E + Cypress |
| Dependencies | ~5 packages          | ~15 packages         |
| Build Time   | ~2-3s                | ~10-15s              |
| Bundle Size  | ~50KB                | ~500KB+              |

## üé® User Experience

### Before

```bash
elizaos create my-plugin
# Creates full plugin with frontend (may be overkill for simple plugins)
```

### After

```bash
elizaos create my-plugin
# Prompts: What type of plugin would you like to create?
# > Quick Plugin (Backend Only)
#   Full Plugin (with Frontend)
```

## üîß Technical Details

### Plugin Quick Starter Structure

```
plugin-quick-starter/
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ src/
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ __tests__/
‚îÇ   ‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ plugin.test.ts
‚îÇ   ‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ test-utils.ts
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ plugin.ts
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ tests.ts
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ index.ts
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ scripts/
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ install-test-deps.js
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ tsup.config.ts
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ tsconfig.json
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ tsconfig.build.json
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ package.json
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ README.md
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ .gitignore
```

### Key Differences in package.json

```json
{
  "scripts": {
    "start": "elizaos start",
    "dev": "elizaos dev",
    "build": "tsc --noEmit && tsup",
    "test": "bun test",
    "format": "prettier --write ./src"
  },
  "dependencies": {
    "@elizaos/core": "workspace:*",
    "zod": "3.24.2"
  },
  "devDependencies": {
    "@elizaos/cli": "latest",
    "dotenv": "16.4.5",
    "prettier": "3.5.3",
    "tsup": "8.5.0",
    "typescript": "5.8.2"
  }
}
```

## ‚úÖ Benefits

1. **Reduced Complexity** - Backend-only plugins start with minimal setup
2. **Faster Development** - Quicker builds and tests for simple plugins
3. **Smaller Footprint** - No unnecessary frontend dependencies
4. **Better DX** - Clear choice based on plugin requirements
5. **Backward Compatible** - No changes to existing plugin-starter template

## üß™ Testing

- [ ] Create quick plugin: `elizaos create test-quick-plugin`
- [ ] Create full plugin: `elizaos create test-full-plugin`
- [ ] Verify quick plugin builds without frontend
- [ ] Verify full plugin maintains all frontend capabilities
- [ ] Test backward compatibility with existing plugins
- [ ] Ensure both templates work with `elizaos dev` and `elizaos start`

## üöÄ Migration Guide

No migration required! Existing plugins continue to work as before. New plugins can choose the appropriate template based on their needs:

- **Use `plugin-quick-starter` when:**

  - Building backend-only functionality
  - Creating services, actions, or providers
  - Frontend is not required
  - Want minimal dependencies

- **Use `plugin-starter` when:**
  - Need a web interface
  - Building interactive dashboards
  - Require frontend/backend integration
  - Want full-stack capabilities

## üîç Review Checklist

- [ ] Code follows ElizaOS conventions
- [ ] Tests pass for both templates
- [ ] Documentation is updated
- [ ] No breaking changes to existing functionality
- [ ] Template copying works correctly
- [ ] CLI prompts are user-friendly

---

**Note**: This PR enhances the plugin creation experience without breaking existing functionality. The original `plugin-starter` remains unchanged, ensuring full backward compatibility.

topPRs.title: feat: improve cli ci tests + migrate to bun native process spawn etc
topPRs.author: wtfsayo
topPRs.body:
## Description

This PR adds the Ollama plugin as a dependency to the ElizaOS CLI package and optimizes the CI/CD workflow for better performance.

## Changes

### üéØ New Feature: Ollama Plugin Integration
- Added `@elizaos/plugin-ollama@1.2.1` as a dependency to the CLI package
- This enables Ollama LLM support directly in the CLI
- Updated `bun.lock` to include `ollama-ai-provider` and its dependencies

### üöÄ CI/CD Optimization
- **Removed redundant Node.js setup** from CLI tests workflow
  - Bun already handles JavaScript/TypeScript execution natively
  - Reduces CI complexity and setup time
- **Removed memory allocation override** from test command
  - Removed `NODE_OPTIONS="--max-old-space-size=8192"` 
  - Tests should run fine with default memory settings
  - Simplifies test execution

### üì¶ Dependency Updates
- Various dependency version updates in `bun.lock`
- Includes updates to `@swc/core`, `@shikijs`, `@types/node`, and other packages

## Testing

- CI workflow changes will be validated by the GitHub Actions run on this PR
- Ollama plugin integration can be tested once merged

## Type of Change

- [x] New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality)
- [x] Performance improvement (optimization to existing functionality)
